content.question: The regions bounded by the graphs of <math alttext="y equals, x over 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals, the sine squared of x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are shaded in the figure above. What is the sum of the areas of the shaded regions?

topic.text: 8.6: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
